ray.misc

Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.misc.Scene

  • public class Scene
extends java.lang.Object
    The scene is just a collection of objects that compose a scene. The camera, the list of lights, and the list of surfaces.
    Author:
    ags

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Background background
      The background, which gives the radiance for rays that don't hit anything.
      protected Camera camera
      The camera for this scene.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Surface> luminaires
      The list of surfaces in the scene that happen to be emitters.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Material> materials
      The list of materials in the scene.
      protected Medium medium
      The medium, which deals with rays in between surfaces
      protected Image outputImage
      Image to be produced by the renderer
      protected java.util.ArrayList<PointLight> pointLights 
      protected Renderer renderer
      The renderer, which isn't really part of the scene but needs to be parsed.
      protected SampleGenerator sampler
      The sampler, which isn't really part of the scene but needs to be parsed.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Surface> surfaces
      The list of surfaces in the scene.

      • incidentRadiance

        public void incidentRadiance(Point3 o,
                             Vector3 dir,
                             Color outRadiance)
        Trace a ray to find direct radiance incident from a particular direction.
        Parameters:
        o - the point on surface, where the ray light will arrive
        dir - The direction from which to look for radiance (surface coordinates)
        outRadiance - The radiance found

      • addSurface

        Adds a surface to the list of surfaces in the scene.
        Parameters:

      • init

        public void init()

      • getFirstIntersection

        public boolean getFirstIntersection(IntersectionRecord outRecord,
                                    Ray ray)
        Set outRecord to the first intersection of ray with the scene. Return true if there was an intersection and false otherwise. If no intersection was found outRecord is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        outRecord - the output IntersectionRecord
        ray - the ray to intesect
        Returns:
        true if and intersection is found.

      • getAnyIntersection

        public boolean getAnyIntersection(IntersectionRecord outRecord,
                                  Ray ray)
        Shadow ray calculations can be considerably accelerated by not bothering to find the first intersection. This record returns any intersection of the ray and the surfaces and returns true if one is found.
        Parameters:
        outRecord - the output record for the intersection
        ray - the ray to intersect
        Returns:
        true if any intersection is found

      • getBoundingBoxExtents

        public Vector3 getBoundingBoxExtents()

      • chooseVisiblePointOnLuminaire

        public boolean chooseVisiblePointOnLuminaire(Point2 seed,
                                             IntersectionRecord iRec,
                                             LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)

      • chooseVisiblePointOnLuminaire

        public boolean chooseVisiblePointOnLuminaire(Point2 seed,
                                             Point3 p,
                                             LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)

      • pdfVisiblePointOnLuminaire

        public double pdfVisiblePointOnLuminaire(Point3 p,
                                         LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)
        The probability density describing the behavior of chooseVisiblePointOnLuminaire. Used for volume points.
        Parameters:
        p - the interaction point.
        lRec - describes conditions of luminaire sampling.
        Returns:
        The probability density (with respect to surface area).
